intro: Anemia rauhiana, commonly known as rough anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It features showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has dark green, palmately lobed leaves that are often hairy and rough to the touch. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodlands. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for pollinators and a component of native plant communities.
